title: [Self-Directed] Designing Mathematics Education in Organizations Using Systems Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Fundamental Mathematical Concepts and Basic Organizational Management Competencies
context.additional_context: A course for managers to strengthen mathematics-based decision-making competencies while considering systemic interactions within organizations

learning_goals: Learners can design data analysis processes using mathematical concepts from a systemic perspective in corporate environments.
Learners can systematically develop solutions for organizational math education problems by applying the five stages of design thinking.
Learners can measure the impact of math education programs on organizational performance using Human Performance Technology (HPT) strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
